pages.text: About Me ~ TODO ~ TODO ~ TODO const cors = 'https://cors-anywhere.herokuapp.com/';   Github activities const githubUrl = 'https://github-contributions-api.herokuapp.com/kjs927/count'; axios.get(`${cors}${githubUrl}`, { crossDomain: true }).then(res => { var dataList = new Array(); var ydata = res.data.data; for(let y in ydata) { var mdata = ydata[y]; for(let m in mdata) { var ddata = mdata[m]; for(let d in ddata) { dataList.push({"date": new Date(y, m - 1, d), "count": ddata[d]}); } } } var yearago = new Date(new Date().setFullYear(new Date().getFullYear() - 1)); yearago.setMonth(yearago.getMonth()); var chart = calendarHeatmap() .data(dataList) .selector('#github-cal-heatmap') .startDate(yearago) .colorRange(['#dae289', '#3b6427']) .tooltipEnabled(true) .legendEnabled(true) .onClick(function (data) { console.log('onClick callback. Data:', data); }); chart(); }).catch(error => { console.log('error', error); }) Leetcode activities const lcUrl = 'https://leetcode.com/api/user_submission_calendar/kjs927/'; axios.get(`${cors}${lcUrl}`, { crossDomain: true }).then(res => { var dataList = new Array(); // *********************************** // ** success => process data ** // *********************************** var chartData = res.data; chartData = chartData.toString(); chartData = chartData.replace('{', ''); chartData = chartData.replace('}', ''); chartData = chartData.replace(/(?:\\[rn]|[\r\n]+)+/g, ""); //console.log(data); chartData = chartData.split(','); for (var i = 0; i < chartData.length; i++) { var d = chartData[i].split(':'); var s = {"date": new Date(parseInt(d[0].replace(/[^0-9]/g, ''))*1000), "count": parseInt(d[1])}; dataList.push(s); } // *********************************** // ** render chart ** // *********************************** var yearago = new Date(new Date().setFullYear(new Date().getFullYear() - 1)); yearago.setMonth(yearago.getMonth()); var chart = calendarHeatmap() .data(dataList) .selector('#leetcode-cal-heatmap') .startDate(yearago) .colorRange(['#dae289', '#3b6427']) .tooltipEnabled(true) .legendEnabled(true) .onClick(function (data) { console.log('onClick callback. Data:', data); }); chart(); }).catch(error => { console.log('error', error); }) Other Special thanks to Hexo,  Icarus for blog templates, iMaeGoo for Night Mode, 辣椒の酱  to customize blog templates, Rob–W,  DKirwan for Heatmap Calendar, 瑪利歐的部落格 for blog deployment.

posts.title: Access Localhost from Anywhere with Ngrok
posts.text: Public URLs for exposing your local web server. https://ngrok.com/download Example:(1). Usage on Windows (my host machine). ngrok help12345678910111213141516171819202122232425262728EXAMPLES: ngrok http 80 # secure public URL for port 80 web server ngrok http -subdomain=baz 8080 # port 8080 available at baz.ngrok.io ngrok http foo.dev:80 # tunnel to host:port instead of localhost ngrok http https://localhost # expose a local https server ngrok tcp 22 # tunnel arbitrary TCP traffic to port 22 ngrok tls -hostname=foo.com 443 # TLS traffic for foo.com to port 443 ngrok start foo bar baz # start tunnels from the configuration fileVERSION: 2.3.35AUTHOR: inconshreveable - <alan@ngrok.com>COMMANDS: authtoken save authtoken to configuration file credits prints author and licensing information http start an HTTP tunnel start start tunnels by name from the configuration file tcp start a TCP tunnel tls start a TLS tunnel update update ngrok to the latest version version print the version string help Shows a list of commands or help for one commandngrok is a command line application, try typing 'ngrok.exe http 80'at this terminal prompt to expose port 80. (2). To expose web server with a HTTP tunnel on port 23000 on Windows. ngrok http 23000 (3). We can surf the web from anywhere now. Referencengrok Official Website

posts.title: Building a Spring Boot Application Using Intellij IDEA
posts.text: “Spring makes programming Java quicker, easier, and safer for everybody. Spring’s focus on speed, simplicity, and productivity has made it the world’s most popular Java framework.” - spring.io Install IntelliJ IDEA Start IntelliJ IDEA and Create New Project Select Spring Initializr -> Project SDKand Next. Project Settings (Optional)and Next. Select Dependencies (Enable Web -> Spring Web Here)and Next. Select Project Location Setup Maven (a build automation tool used primarily for Java projects)(1). File -> Settings(2). Build, Execution and Deployment -> Build Tools -> Maven(3). Download Apache Maven (https://maven.apache.org/) and Create a Folder for Maven Repository(4). Setup Apache Maven folder -> conf folder -> settings.xml(5). Fill Maven home directory, User settings file and Local repository in Intellij IDEA settings.Apply and OK(6). We Got Some Error Information from Default Maven Settings Here(7). Click Reload All Maven Projects on Top-Right Corner, and Wait for Maven Import Completion(8). Errors were resolved Create a Simple Web ApplicationCreate a Simple Web Application1234567891011121314package com.example.springboot;import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.RestController;import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.RequestMapping;@RestControllerpublic class HelloController { @RequestMapping("/") public String index() { return "Greetings from Spring Boot!"; }} Click Run DemoApplication Button on Top-Right Corner (Shift + F10) Done! ReferenceIntelliJ IDEA Official WebsiteSpring Official WebsiteApache Maven Official Website

posts.title: What's the Difference Between CI and CD (and the Other CD)?
posts.text: Abstract from RedHat [What is CI/CD?] Continuous integration (CI) helps developers merge their code changes back to a shared branch, or “trunk,” more frequently—sometimes even daily. If automated testing discovers a conflict between new and existing code, CI makes it easier to fix those bugs quickly and often. Continuous delivery (CD), the goal of continuous delivery is to have a codebase that is always ready for deployment to a production environment. Continuous deployment (CD), as an extension of continuous delivery, continuous deployment means that a developer’s change to a cloud application could go live within minutes of writing it (assuming it passes automated testing). This makes it much easier to continuously receive and incorporate user feedback.   Relationship Diagram Red Hat, Inc.Source: https://www.redhat.com/en/topics/devops/what-is-ci-cd Code MazeSource: https://www.codeproject.com/articles/1078439/what-is-continuous-integration-and-why-do-you-need Referencehttps://www.redhat.com/en/topics/devops/what-is-ci-cdhttp://devopstechie.com/continuous-integration-vs-continuous-delivery-vs-continuous-deployment/
